answer_html: So a function can be continuous, without necessarily being differentiable.Thus the statement is false.
hints_html: What makes a function non-differentiable? Can you draw a continuous function with this property?
hints_latex:
What makes a function non-differentiable? Can you draw a continuous
function with this property?
hints_raw: What makes a function non-differentiable?  Can you draw a continuous function with this property?
question: 2 (e)
sols_html:
A function is non-differentiable if it has a vertical tangent or a sharp corner (cusp). A function is continuous if it can be drawn in one go without lifting your pencil. It is possible to draw a continuous function with one (or multiple!) of the non-differentiable properties just listed:

So a function can be continuous, without necessarily being differentiable. Thus the statement is false.
sols_latex:
A function is non-differentiable if it has a vertical tangent or a sharp
corner (cusp). A function is continuous if it can be drawn in one go
without lifting your pencil. It is possible to draw a continuous
function with one (or multiple!) of the non-differentiable properties
just listed:

\includegraphics[width=0.5\textwidth]{../json_data/MATH110/December_2012/MER_MATH110_December_2012_Question_2e_cusp_example.jpg}
\includegraphics[width=0.5\textwidth]{../json_data/MATH110/December_2012/MER_MATH110_December_2012_Question_2e_vertical_tangent.jpg}

So a function can be continuous, without necessarily being
differentiable. Thus the statement is false.
sols_raw:
A function is non-differentiable if it has a vertical tangent or a sharp corner (cusp).  A function is continuous if it can be drawn in one go without lifting your pencil.  It is possible to draw a continuous function with one (or multiple!) of the non-differentiable properties just listed:  

[[File:MER MATH110 December 2012 Question 2e cusp example.jpg|200px]]  [[File:MER MATH110 December 2012 Question 2e vertical tangent.jpg|200px]]

So a function can be continuous, without necessarily being differentiable.  Thus the statement is false.
statement_html:
Determine whether the following statement is true or false. If it is true, provide justification. If it is false, provide a counterexample.

If a function is continuous, then it is differentiable.
statement_latex:
Determine whether the following statement is true or false. If it is
true, provide justification. If it is false, provide a counterexample.

If a function is continuous, then it is differentiable.
statement_raw:
Determine whether the following statement is true or false. If it is true, provide justification. If it is false, provide a counterexample.

If a function is continuous, then it is differentiable.
